page.title: 13HOLKHAM HALL YEARS AGO
page.content: Sir Edward Coke was born in 1551. He was the founder of the family fortunes. He had twelve children. Thomas Coke who was born in 1697 built Holkham Hall. Another Thomas William Coke became the Earl of Leicester in 1837. He was also known as Coke of Norfolk because of his work as a farmer. The estate is at present managed by Viscount Coke, son of the sixth Earl of Leicester. The kitchen is reached by going down many passages and shows the hard work which went into cooking meals in days gone by. The pans had to be polished regularly to keep them clean.
